Items.Title: THE PUBLIC ADVOCATE (Ms. Gotbaum) called the Meeting to order.
Roll Call
THE CLERK will announced the presence of a quorum.
Supplemental Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting certificate setting forth the maximum amount of debt and reserves which the City, the NYC Transitional Finance Authority, the NYC Municipal Water Finance Authority, the NYS Dormitory Authority and the NYC Health and Hospitals Corporation may soundly incur for capital projects for Fiscal Year 2007 and the ensuing three fiscal years, and the maximum amount of appropriations and expenditures for capital projects which may soundly be made during each fiscal year, pursuant to Section 250 (16) of the NY City Charter.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Setting forth the maximum amount of debt and reserves.

Items.Title: Supplemental Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Supplemental Petitions and Communications
Supplemental Land Use Call-Ups
Supplemental Communication from the Speaker
Supplemental Discussion of General Orders
Supplemental Report of Special Committees
Supplemental Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Parks and Recreation

A Local Law in relation to the naming of five thoroughfares and public places, Actors’ Equity Corner, Borough of Manhattan, Josephine Diana Blvd., Borough of Brooklyn, Rev. Msgr. Bryan J. Karvelis Way, Borough of Brooklyn, Sgt. Jose Gomez Place, Borough of Queens and Dr. Reverend Wyatt Tee Walker Square, Borough of Manhattan and the repeal of sections 3, 26 and 47 of local law number 13 for the year 2006.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Council

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.3034-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.6233-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to terminal leave”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.7830, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.10182, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the twenty year retirement program established for members of the New York city employees’ retirement system employed as investigators by district attorneys’ offices”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Retirement program for investigators employed by district attorneys.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Padavan, S.8288, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to the determination of adjusted base proportions in special assessing units which are cities for the fiscal year 2007”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Montgomery, S.3265-A, and Assembly Member Robinson, A.6376-A, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Robert Cradle, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1832, Lot No. 9 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.5459-B, and Assembly Member Cymbrowitz, A.8375-C, “AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to increasing the earned income tax credit against the personal income tax of a city having a population of one million or more”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the earned income tax credit against the personal income tax of a city having a pop. of one million or more.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by the Assembly Committee on Rules, A.11989, “AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue the use as parkland of a portion of real property in the borough of Manhattan and to use such property as well as property under the jurisdiction of the city of New York department of transportation for expansion of the West 96th Street Subway Station in exchange for the dedication of certain other lands in the borough of Manhattan for park purposes”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass A.06222/S.03178, which would amend the Public Employees Fair Employment Act to provide penalties for employers who fail to bargain in good faith and to mitigate penalties for employees of such employers.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Amend the Public Employees Fair Employment Act.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Hassell-Thompson, S.2250-A, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of the Bronx to former owner, Estate of Elia Figueroa without public auction and notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 3062, Lot No. 3 on tax map for the borough of the Bronx”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: In Rem, Estate of Elia Figueroa, The Bronx (S.2250-A).

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State of New York to assist the City of New York in subsidizing the 21,000 non-federal housing units managed by the New York City Housing Authority.

Items.MatterName: Assist NYC in subsidizing the 21,000 non-federal housing units managed by the NYC Housing Authority.

Items.Title: A Local Law  to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the unauthorized operation of a recording device in a place of public performance.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs

Items.Title: Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application no. C 060294 ZMQ pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter, concerning an amendment to the zoning map, Sections 9b, 9d and 13c, Borough of Queens, Council District no. 26.

Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Items.MinutesNote: Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) recessed the Meeting.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:  SLR 123 and SLR 125.
